(44) 620.3rd November, 1944.WAR CABINET.CONTROLS IN THE TRANSITION.Note by the Prime Minister and Minister of Defence.I have been reflecting on our conversation in Cabinet yesterday,* and have come to the conclusion that the matter is one which affects the general policyand outlook of the Government to such an extent that I should myself answer the question which was to be arranged. I do not feel it difficult to do this in a manner agreeable to the general interests of the Coalition at the present juncture.I hope, therefore, my colleagues will agree to this arrangement in preference tothe one which I suggested and they approved yesterday.(Initialled) W. S. C.10 Downing Street, S. W. 1,3rd November, 1944.* W.M. (44) 145th Conclusions, Minute 5.[28534]
